metadata.title: CVE-2019-9456 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In the Android kernel in Pixel C USB monitor driver there is a possible OOBwrite due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1022.22
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1022.22').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
